repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Since #25209 got merged, `foldtext` can be highlighted with treesitter. This PR adds `vim.treesitter.foldtext` next to `vim.treesitter.foldexpr` that shows the first line of the fold with treesitter highlighting.

![Screenshot 2023-09-27 at 18 55 43](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/4084982/1e6bf121-55e1-4828-9152-9e027a16bc4c)

comment_data.body: I think we should also feature this in `news.txt` :)

```suggestion
  for id, node in query:iter_captures(tree:root(), 0, foldstart - 1, foldstart) do
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,60 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)
+  if not parser then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local query = ts.query.get(parser:lang(), 'highlights')
+  if not query then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local tree = parser:parse({ foldstart - 1, foldstart })[1]
+
+  local line = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, foldstart - 1, foldstart, false)[1]
+
+  ---@type { [1]: string, [2]: string }[]
+  local result = {}
+
+  local line_pos = 0
+
+  local prev_range = nil
+
+  for id, node, _ in query:iter_captures(tree:root(), 0, foldstart - 1, foldstart) do

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
      if prev_range and start_col == prev_range[1] and end_col == prev_range[2] then
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,60 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)
+  if not parser then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local query = ts.query.get(parser:lang(), 'highlights')
+  if not query then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local tree = parser:parse({ foldstart - 1, foldstart })[1]
+
+  local line = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, foldstart - 1, foldstart, false)[1]
+
+  ---@type { [1]: string, [2]: string }[]
+  local result = {}
+
+  local line_pos = 0
+
+  local prev_range = nil
+
+  for id, node, _ in query:iter_captures(tree:root(), 0, foldstart - 1, foldstart) do
+    local name = query.captures[id]
+
+    local start_row, start_col, end_row, end_col = node:range()
+
+    if start_row == foldstart - 1 and end_row == foldstart - 1 then
+      -- check for characters ignored by treesitter
+      if start_col > line_pos then
+        table.insert(result, { line:sub(line_pos + 1, start_col), 'Folded' })
+      end
+      line_pos = end_col
+
+      local text = ts.get_node_text(node, 0)
+
+      -- replace item if it has multiple captures
+      if prev_range ~= nil and start_col == prev_range[1] and end_col == prev_range[2] then

comment_data.body: I might be wrong but I think `pcall` is preferred over `vim.F.npcall`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,93 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)

comment_data.body: I think we should check that `nvim_buf_get_lines` returns a non-empty result before indexing.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

 end

+

comment_data.body: I don't think this `clear()` is needed since the suite already [does that](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/1d494c9c64dd8d5d5aa661598f78a0df935246b5/test/functional/treesitter/fold_spec.lua#L10).
Will change it, thanks. As an FYI `foldexpr` further up in the file also uses `vim.F.npcall`, which is where I got that from.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,93 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)

comment_data.body: Indexing an empty table will just return `nil`, but we should check that `line` is non-nil before continuing.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,93 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)
+  if not parser then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local query = ts.query.get(parser:lang(), 'highlights')
+  if not query then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local tree = parser:parse({ foldstart - 1, foldstart })[1]
+
+  local line = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, foldstart - 1, foldstart, false)[1]

comment_data.body:
Is it possible to use `line` here instead of calling `get_node_text`? We already called `nvim_buf_get_lines` to get buffer text, this will do the same thing so is redundant and possibly wasteful.

If this correctly handles an edge case then it's ok to leave as-is, but please leave a comment indicating that.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,93 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)
+  if not parser then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local query = ts.query.get(parser:lang(), 'highlights')
+  if not query then
+    return vim.fn.foldtext()
+  end
+
+  local tree = parser:parse({ foldstart - 1, foldstart })[1]
+
+  local line = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, foldstart - 1, foldstart, false)[1]
+
+  ---@type { [1]: string, [2]: string[], range: { [1]: integer, [2]: integer } }[] | { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]
+  local result = {}
+
+  local line_pos = 0
+
+  for id, node, metadata in query:iter_captures(tree:root(), 0, foldstart - 1, foldstart) do
+    local name = query.captures[id]
+    local start_row, start_col, end_row, end_col = node:range()
+
+    local priority = tonumber(metadata.priority or vim.highlight.priorities.treesitter)
+
+    if start_row == foldstart - 1 and end_row == foldstart - 1 then
+      -- check for characters ignored by treesitter
+      if start_col > line_pos then
+        table.insert(result, {
+          line:sub(line_pos + 1, start_col),
+          { { 'Folded', priority } },
+          range = { line_pos, start_col },
+        })
+      end
+      line_pos = end_col
+
+      local text = ts.get_node_text(node, 0)

comment_data.body: No edgecase that I can think of, I'll change it to use `line:sub`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,93 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end

comment_data.body: @tbung no worries, we've had issues with consistency before :)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,93 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil
+function M.foldtext()
+  local foldstart = vim.v.foldstart
+  local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+
+  ---@type LanguageTree|nil
+  local parser = vim.F.npcall(ts.get_parser, bufnr)

comment_data.body: Is the `|nil` needed? I don't see any codepath potentially returning `nil`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,96 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil

comment_data.body: No, that's a relic from when I thought returning `nil` would be the better failure mode than to fall back to `foldtext`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,4 +361,96 @@ function M.foldexpr(lnum)
   return foldinfos[bufnr].levels[lnum] or '0'
 end
 
+---@package
+---@return { [1]: string, [2]: string[] }[]|string|nil

comment_regular_data.body: Small disclaimer that I _think_ I was the one who encouraged @tbung to make this PR on reddit, so if @lewis6991 or @clason find this proposal unsuitable for core, blame me.

Yes, indeed! Thank you for suggesting this/encouraging me! 


If it turns out this is not suitable for core, that's completely fine and I'll make a small plugin out of it.

There is also some discussion to be had about the default style, currently it just displays the line as is, merged with the `Folded` hl group. It might be better to include the number of hidden lines as the default does or give more customization options to people.

> > There is also some discussion to be had about the default style, currently it just displays the line as is, merged with the Folded hl group. It might be better to include the number of hidden lines as the default does or give more customization options to people.

> 
> IMO we can tweak the interface later (if it's changed during the release cycle we don't need to worry about backward compatibility). Let's not block a useful feature on excessive bike shedding (if it can be helped).

I do think customization should be on the roadmap (in a later PR of course).

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/20750 was an alternative to this which has a simpler implementation and presumably more performant. 

What are the pros/cons vs this one?
This one is less likely to crash? There are previous issues about crashes with legacy syntax and folds.

> Small disclaimer that I _think_ I was the one who encouraged @tbung to make this PR on reddit, so if @lewis6991 or @clason find this proposal unsuitable for core, blame me.

Not at all! This is a welcome contribution, and nicely done (it even comes with a test  ) I just held off on commenting (with praise) until it's marked as ready.

Thank you all for the comments!

I was going to go over everything now that it's morning and then mark as ready. I am currently working on fixing the bug @gpanders noticed, turns out my handling of nested captures was too naive. I'll update the code and tests later today!

> #20750 was an alternative to this which has a simpler implementation and presumably more performant.
> 
> What are the pros/cons vs this one?

Also, it's easy to modify a virtual text item to add more information or remove unnecessary information.
I actually just found another bug, but will update in a minute.
Ok, now it should be ready for review. I also added another test case for the bug I found.
Apparently `table.sort` does not always like `<=` in the comparison function, so I removed it. I also rebased on master again.

Thank you all for reviewing and merging! I'd be happy to drive further development on this when there has been some discussion on how to move forward. Let me know if I should open a draft pr or write an issue on this.

> I do think customization should be on the roadmap (in a later PR of course).

Hi @MariaSolOs are there any plans (or is it possible already via some lua manipulations) to show conceal characters in the folded text? For instance in my image below you can see that the folded `H1-1` header doesn't display the conceal circle symbol of the unfolded `H1-2` header. Thanks in advance!

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/2583971/90dea1c0-928b-445c-aae5-9d70e01c7ba5)
@petobens Hmmm I'm not sure. @clason / @tbung / @lewis6991 might now better.

repo.name: neovim

title: feat(treesitter): add foldtext with treesitter highlighting
